Modify colour transparency

Source: R/colour-manip.R
alpha.Rd

Vectorised in both colour and alpha.

Usage

alpha(colour, alpha = NA)

Arguments

colour

colour

alpha

new alpha level in [0,1]. If alpha is NA, existing alpha values are preserved.

See also

Other colour manipulation: col2hcl(), col_mix(), colour_manip, muted()

Examples

alpha("red", 0.1)
#> [1] "#FF00001A"
alpha(colours(), 0.5)
#>   [1] "#FFFFFF80" "#F0F8FF80" "#FAEBD780" "#FFEFDB80" "#EEDFCC80"
#>   [6] "#CDC0B080" "#8B837880" "#7FFFD480" "#7FFFD480" "#76EEC680"

alpha("red", seq(0, 1, length.out = 10))
#>  [1] "#FF000000" "#FF00001C" "#FF000039" "#FF000055" "#FF000071"
#>  [6] "#FF00008E" "#FF0000AA" "#FF0000C6" "#FF0000E3" "#FF0000"  
alpha(c("first" = "gold", "second" = "lightgray", "third" = "#cd7f32"), .5)
#>       first      second       third 
#> "#FFD70080" "#D3D3D380" "#CD7F3280"
